com.ibm.mfp.server.registration.external.device.management.MFPDeviceStatus

  • Packages that use MFPDeviceStatus 
    Package Description
    com.ibm.mfp.server.registration.external.device.management  
    com.ibm.mfp.server.registration.external.model  

    • Uses of MFPDeviceStatus in com.ibm.mfp.server.registration.external.device.management

      Fields in com.ibm.mfp.server.registration.external.device.management declared as MFPDeviceStatus 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static MFPDeviceStatus MFPDeviceStatus.ACTIVE
      An active device
      static MFPDeviceStatus MFPDeviceStatus.DISABLED
      A device that has been disabled
      static MFPDeviceStatus MFPDeviceStatus.EXPIRED
      A device that has not connected to the MobileFirst Server for a certain configurable period
      static MFPDeviceStatus MFPDeviceStatus.LOST
      A device that has been marked as lost by the administrator
      static MFPDeviceStatus MFPDeviceStatus.STOLEN
      A device that has been marked as stolen by the administrator
      Methods in com.ibm.mfp.server.registration.external.device.management that return MFPDeviceStatus 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static MFPDeviceStatus MFPDeviceStatus.valueOf(int v)
      Returns the device status with the specified numeric identifier
      static MFPDeviceStatus MFPDeviceStatus.valueOf(java.lang.String name) 
      static MFPDeviceStatus[] MFPDeviceStatus.values() 

    • Uses of MFPDeviceStatus in com.ibm.mfp.server.registration.external.model

      Methods in com.ibm.mfp.server.registration.external.model that return MFPDeviceStatus 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MFPDeviceStatus DeviceData.getStatus()
      Returns the status of the device.
      Methods in com.ibm.mfp.server.registration.external.model with parameters of type MFPDeviceStatus 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void DeviceData.setStatus(MFPDeviceStatus deviceStatus)
      Sets the status of the device.
      Note that adapters must call AdapterSecurityContext.storeClientRegistrationData to store changes in the registration data, such as the device status.
